title: Can I get a list of king demons, demons that represent anger? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can't, because although negative entities/spirits/demons or whatever we choose to call them DO exist, 'demonology' is a man made subject written of by men. There are no human experts on this subject, just several claims and made up books, over-theatrical and over-exaggerated movies and TV shows. These ancient beings predate humanity by an eternity and are highly intelligent, cunning and insidious. They rarely speak of names and hierarchy, and when they do it's always a lie. They're experts at mixing part truths with lies to keep people hooked and to form a fake trust/bond to strengthen their attachment to a home, person, land, animal or object. They'll tell us whatever we want to hear and pretend to be whoever we want or expect them to be in order to further deceive. There are no king demons and none that represent emotions. There are no incubi, succubi, shapeshifters or poltergeists either, they're basically all the same type of entity and all are capable of pretty much the same thing, depending on their agenda. A lot of nonsense (deluded, deliberate or ignorant) has been written about these beings over the centuries, and as I mentioned before, there are no experts on them, myself included. I can only give my opinion based on dealing with these things for over 30 years. Demonology and magic books are made up. As well as all of the above, humans can't summon or command one of these beings either. It's another myth. They don't answer to any human, but they will pretend to if it suits their agenda and forms a bond and strong attachment to the gullible human. I hope this helps.

From the Ars Goetia: Kings of Hell: Baal: First king of Hell. Rules the east, has 66 legions of demons. Teaches invisibility.Paimon: More loyal to Lucifer than other kings. Rules the northwest, has a roaring voice. Teaches arts, philosophy, and sciences.Beleth: A “mighty and terrible” king with 85 legions. Attempts to scare the conjured, but then can make men and women fall in love with them (I think).Purson: A king with 22 legions of demons, who can find hidden things, find treasures, tells the future, and knows the creation of the world.Asmodeus: A powerful and dangerous king of Hell. His name means “wrath demon,” but he’s actually associated with Lust. Breaks up marriages, encourages adultery. Associated with luxury and pleasure.Vine: A king and earl of Hell, commands 36 legions of demons, knows the past, present, and future, finds hidden things, creates storms, destroys or builds towers.Balam: A powerful king of Hell with 46 legions of demons, can answer questions about the past or future, teaches invisibility, and improves wit.Zagan: A king and president of Hell, with 33 legions of demons. Improves wit, and transfigures things (wine to water, water to wine, blood to wine, blood to oil, oil to blood, raw metals into coins).Belial: A king of Hell with 80 legions of demons. Gives “presentations and senatorships.”Of Peter Binsfeld’s Seven Princes of Hell, Satan is the one that represents wrath (and “Satan” is distinct from “Lucifer,” by the way).
List of demons in the Ars Goetia - Wikipedia It will show you who is and are the demons of anger.
Asmodeus as mentioned before. Satan and Moloch, ”the two contending giants”, per Qlippothoc tree - the lowest, or highest, sphere in Qlippoth depending on how you view the Tree of Death.
